# Copilot Instructions for Crewbot1501

## Project Overview
Crewbot1501 is a bot/automation project. Use this file to guide GitHub Copilot when working in this repository.

## General Guidelines
- Write clear, readable, and well-documented code.
- Follow consistent naming conventions throughout the codebase.
- Prefer simple and maintainable solutions over clever or overly complex ones.
- Keep functions and modules focused on a single responsibility.

## Code Style
- Use descriptive variable and function names.
- Add comments to explain non-obvious logic.
- Keep lines reasonably short and well-formatted.

## Testing
- Write tests for new functionality.
- Ensure existing tests continue to pass after making changes.
- Aim for meaningful test coverage rather than 100% line coverage.

## Pull Requests
- Make small, focused pull requests that address a single concern.
- Include a clear description of what was changed and why.
- Reference any related issues in the PR description.
